column4: the first time it booted it went into low graphic mode and then i restarted it and it type nomodeset again and it worked
OK so you've got the GUI with windows and mouse again now?
yes
right, start that terminal again, then do "gksudo gedit /etc/default/grub"
okay
OK... find that line GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT="" and insert in the quotemarks nomodeset so you have ...="nomodeset"
got it
want me to save now?
great. Now File > Save and quit the editor, back to the command line
okay back
then you can do "sudo update-grub" and let it fix that change for all future boots
I guess you'd best reboot and prove that has fixed it before I go off to bed! :p
back? from where? you mean the terminal prompt?
yeah haha! and no i mean like theres usually ruben@ruben inspiron then like dash and the moneys ign and what not but right now there isnt
have you done "sudo update-grub" yet?
how do i like reset the terminal
If you're in that terminal window... and you don't see the prompt... try just pressing enter a few times to give it a reminder
usually before i give a prompt it says :ruben@ruben-Inspiron-1100:~$
did you quit out of the text-editor? if you didn't that might keep the prompt from re-appearing
If all else fails, close the terminal window and start a new one :D
do we know what it's doing? :)
updating grub haha
ha! phew
